Thomas Lane

Bio

Biography

Casady High School

Attended Casady High School in Oklahoma City, Okla. ...Averaged 21 points per game as a senior as team finished 17-8 ...Averaged 17.8 points, eight rebounds and four assists for the Cyclones as a junior ...Rated a three-star commitment from Rivals.com ...Averaged 11 points per game as a sophomore as team went 16-9 ...Played in the Little All-City All-Star Game ...Named first-team all-Southwest Preparatory Conference as a junior and senior in basketball and honorable-mention as a freshman and sophomore ...Also first-team all-conference his final three years in volleyball ...Earned three letters in volleyball, where he was a two-time team MVP for coach Seth Vanneta, and one letter each in baseball and track & field ......Owns volleyball school records for kills and attempts in a season ...Was leading scorer (22 ppg.) at the adidas Showtime Nationals in the summer of 2004, where he played for the Oklahoma Aces ...High school coach was Brad Shelley.

Personal

Son of Richard and Pam Lane ...Born Aug. 15, 1986 in Amarillo, Texas ...Has siblings Jennifer (21) and Taylor (16) ...Grandfather Eddie Fisher played baseball at Oklahoma ...Favorite athlete is Adrian Peterson ...Best player he’s faced is Taylor Griffin ...A history major who aspires to become a lawyer ...Nickname is “T-Lane”.
